g.text: Linear threshold unit for binary classification
Creates hyperplane to separate two classes
net = w₀ + Σᵢ₌₁ⁿ wᵢxᵢ = w₀ + w·x
w = [w₀, w₁, ..., wₙ] randomly or zero
If all patterns classified correctly → STOP
If training data is linearly separable, the perceptron
learning algorithm will converge to a solution in finite steps.
• Distance to optimal hyperplane decreases with each update
• Bound exists on number of updates needed
• Upper bound: finite number of steps
Guaranteed convergence for linearly separable problems
